metadata.title: CVE-2019-16935 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The documentation XML-RPC server in Python through 2.7.16, 3.x through3.6.9, and 3.7.x through 3.7.4 has XSS via the server_title field. Thisoccurs in Lib/DocXMLRPCServer.py in Python 2.x, and in Lib/xmlrpc/server.pyin Python 3.x. If set_server_title is called with untrusted input,arbitrary JavaScript can be delivered to clients that visit the http URLfor this server.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-16935` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm3
libpython2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm3
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm3
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm3
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm3
python2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm3
python2.7-examples - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm3
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

idle-python3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm4
libpython3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm4
libpython3.4-minimal - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm4
libpython3.4-stdlib - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm4
libpython3.4-testsuite - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm4
python3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm4
python3.4-examples - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm4
python3.4-minimal - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm4
python3.4-venv - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm3').
python3.4 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm4').
python3.5 package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
